Fever.context: The patient is a 10-month-old male who was seen in the office 1 day prior to admission. He has had a 2-day history of fever that has gone up to as high as 103.6 degrees F.

otitis media.context: Admitting Diagnoses: 1. Fever. 2. Otitis media. 3. Possible sepsis.

possible sepsis.context: Admitting Diagnoses: 1. Fever. 2. Otitis media. 3. Possible sepsis.

10-month-old male.context: The patient is a 10-month-old male who was seen in the office 1 day prior to admission.

intermittent cough.context: He has also had intermittent cough, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea and no history of rashes.

nasal congestion.context: He has also had intermittent cough, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea and no history of rashes.

rhinorrhea.context: He has also had intermittent cough, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea and no history of rashes.

no history of rashes.context: He has also had intermittent cough, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea and no history of rashes.

Tylenol.context: He has been taking Tylenol and Advil to help decrease the fevers, but the fever has continued to rise.

Advil.context: He has been taking Tylenol and Advil to help decrease the fevers, but the fever has continued to rise.

increased workup of breathing.context: He was noted to have some increased workup of breathing and parents returned to the office on the day of admission.

born at 33 weeks' gestation.context: Significant for being born at 33 weeks' gestation with a birth weight of 5 pounds and 1 ounce.

birth weight of 5 pounds and 1 ounce.context: Significant for being born at 33 weeks' gestation with a birth weight of 5 pounds and 1 ounce.

moderately ill appearing and lethargic.context: On exam, he was moderately ill appearing and lethargic.

tympanic membranes were red and yellow,.context: Tympanic membranes were red and yellow, and opaque bilaterally.

increased workup of breathing, moderate.context: Lungs showed increased workup of breathing, moderate tachypnea.

no rales, rhonchi or wheezes.context: No rales, rhonchi or wheezes were noted.

electrolytes, BUN and creatinine, and gl.context: He had electrolytes, BUN and creatinine, and glucose all of which were within normal limits.

White blood cell count was 8.6 with 61%.context: White blood cell count was 8.6 with 61% neutrophils, 21% lymphocytes, 17% monocytes, suggestive of a viral infection.

Chest x-ray showed a suboptimal inspirat.context: Chest x-ray showed a suboptimal inspiration, but no evidence of an acute process in the chest.

ceftriaxone 500 mg IV once daily.context: He was given ceftriaxone 500 mg IV once daily to treat otitis media and possible sepsis, and I will add Tylenol and ibuprofen as needed for fevers.

Tylenol and ibuprofen.context: He was given ceftriaxone 500 mg IV once daily to treat otitis media and possible sepsis, and I will add Tylenol and ibuprofen as needed for fevers.

oxygen saturations drop.context: Overnight, he did have his oxygen saturations drop and went into oxygen overnight.

albuterol aerosols every 6 hours.context: His lungs remained clear, but because of the need for O2, we instituted albuterol aerosols every 6 hours to help maintain good lung function.

afebrile.context: He has become afebrile and was having no further increased work of breathing.

no further increased work of breathing.context: He has become afebrile and was having no further increased work of breathing.

Omnicef 125 mg/5 mL one teaspoon p.o. on.context: He was continued Omnicef 125 mg/5 mL one teaspoon p.o. once daily and instructed to follow up with Dr. X, his primary doctor, on the following Tuesday.
